In its advanced stage —acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) —the infected individual has no protection from diseases that may not even threaten people who have healthy immune systems. The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) kills or impairs the cells of the immune system and progressively destroys the body's ability to protect itself. Over time, a person with a deficient immune system ( immunodeficiency ) may become vulnerable to common and even simple infections by disease-causing organisms such as bacteria or viruses.
